title: If a:b = 4:5 and b:c = 3:2 then what is the value of a:b:c? - Quora

response.answer_text: I THINK YOU ARE A PRIMARY CLASS STUDENT NOT WILLING TO TRY YOUR HOMEWORK OF YOUR OWN.STILL I WILL ANSWER,THOUGH I AM NOT INTERESTED TO ENCOURAGE THIS TYPE OF QUESTION IN MATHS. IF A:B=4:5 B:C=3:2 UPON CROSS MULTIPLYING ,YOU WILL GET A:B:C =12:15:10 ANS:12:15:10 NEXT TIME YOU MUST TRY TO SOLVE PROBLEMS LIKE THIS OF YOUR OWN.

The goal in these types of questions is to arrange that common letters (in this case, b) have the same ratio value (5 for the first and 3 from the second). That arrangement can be made by multiplying the first by 3 and the second by 5. Now the equations read [math]a:b=12:15[/math] and [math]b:c=15:10[/math]. Now the b’s correspond to [math]15[/math]. Now we can direct and rearrange to write [math]a:b:c=12:15:10[/math].
